note.p: Birth: Elphinstone Tower, near Stirling, Scotland (07 January 1746)
Death: Tulliallan, on the north bank of the Forth, Fife (10 March 1823)

Career: Entered Royal Navy (1758); Dutch fleet surrended to him at Saldanah Bay (1796); as Commissioner in Chief quelled Mutiny of the Nose; Commissioner in Chief, Mediterranean (1799-1802); Admiral of the Blue (1801); Admiral of the White (1805); Admiral of the Red (1810); conducted correspondance with Napoleon regarding his exile to St Helena
